hyperCycle
Class HyperCycleAutomaton

java.lang.Object
  hyperCycle.HyperCycleAutomaton
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, sim.engine.Steppable
public class HyperCycleAutomaton
extends java.lang.Object
implements sim.engine.Steppable

This class implements the basic automaton. An instance of this class will be called every frame in the simulation. This automaton holds no information except the current parameter set. In overall this class provides the computational process only.

The information for computing is provided by an instance of the HyperCycleSimulation class. This instance will be accessible in the step(SimState) method. The step(SimState) will be called every simulation frame and calls the cycle(IntGrid2D, IntGrid2D) method with the appropriate parameters.

This automaton uses only basic data structures of the MASON library and is really straightforward. I did no profiling to optimize the execution speed but I've got the feeling the Java compiler is doing a good job on optimizing so there is no need to do it yourself. If you need more speed work on the visualization process.

Author:
hoehne

cycle

private final void cycle(sim.field.grid.IntGrid2D d,
                         sim.field.grid.IntGrid2D buffer)
A single cycle in the life of the cellular automaton. Compute for every cell the next state and also apply the Toffoli & Margolus diffusion.

Parameters:

buffer -

turn22

private final void turn22(sim.field.grid.IntGrid2D grid,
                          int x,
                          int y)
Diffuse a 2x2 block clockwise or counter-clockwise. This procedure was published by Toffoli and Margolus to simulate the diffusion in an ideal gas. The 2x2 blocks will be turned by random in one direction (clockwise or counter clockwise). Usually a second run will be done but this time with a offset of one to the previous run

Parameters:
grid -
x -
y -
